identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a premium, elegant, and airy real estate platform that feels like a high-end magazine, not a chunky database.

accent.name: Antique Gold
accent.usage: Icons, Thin Borders, Highlights, Secondary Buttons

buttons.primary: bg-[#003167] text-white hover:bg-[#002347] rounded-sm px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all duration-300
buttons.secondary: bg-transparent border border-[#C9A227] text-[#003167] hover:bg-[#C9A227] hover:text-white rounded-sm px-8 py-3 transition-all duration-300

cards.property: group bg-white rounded-sm overflow-hidden hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-500 border border-slate-100
cards.agent: bg-white p-6 text-center hover:-translate-y-1 transition-transform duration-300

inputs.default: border-slate-200 focus:border-[#003167] focus:ring-1 focus:ring-[#003167] rounded-sm bg-slate-50

layouts.grid_strategy: Use 'Masonry' or 'Asymmetrical' grids for listings to break monotony. Avoid rigid equal-height rows where possible.

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. UPDATE TAILWIND: Configure 'font-serif' to ['Playfair Display', 'serif'] and 'font-sans' to ['Manrope', 'sans-serif'].
3. CONFIGURE COLORS: Update tailwind.config.js to use the specific hex codes provided in 'design_system.colors'.
4. REFACTOR CARDS: Remove thick borders. Use 'shadow-sm' and 'hover:shadow-lg'. Increase padding inside cards to 'p-6'.
5. TYPOGRAPHY OVERHAUL: Change all Section Headings to 'font-serif text-[#003167]'. Ensure body text is 'font-light' or 'font-normal' (never bold for large blocks).
6. HEADER/FOOTER: Do not modify the structural code of Header/Footer, but apply the new font classes to them if possible to match the theme.
7. IMAGES: Use the provided Unsplash URLs. Do not use placeholders.
8. DATA-TESTID: Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, cards).
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI Slop': Do not use generic gradients or centered text everywhere.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
